entries.title: Vivienne Westwood, influential fashion maverick, dies at 81
entries.description: Vivienne Westwood, an influential fashion maverick who played a key role in the punk movement, died Thursday at 81.

entries.title: Pelé, Brazilian soccer legend, dies at 82
entries.description: Brazilian soccer icon Pelé, regarded as the sport’s greatest player whose wizardry on the pitch helped popularize it as "the beautiful game," died Thursday

entries.title: Benjamin Netanyahu back in office as Israel's prime minister
entries.description: Israel’s longest-serving prime minister completed a dramatic comeback when he was sworn in for a sixth term after being ousted last year by a coalition of opponents in a series of close-fought elections.

entries.title: Netanyahu seals dramatic comeback as he is sworn in as Israel prime minister
entries.description: Benjamin Netanyahu was sworn into office Thursday, taking the helm of the most right-wing and religiously conservative government in Israel’s history.

entries.title: Pope Emeritus Benedict is 'lucid and vigilant' but still in serious condition, Vatican says
entries.description: Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI is "lucid and vigilant," the Vatican said Thursday, but still remains in serious condition.

entries.title: Kyiv residents shelter in metro station amid Russian shelling across Ukraine
entries.description: Kyiv residents sheltered in a metro station as Russia launched its biggest wave of missile strikes in Ukraine in weeks, hitting targets across the country. Russian shelling also targeted Lviv, Kharkiv, Odesa and Zaporizhzhia among other cities in the strikes.

entries.title: Novak Djokovic says there are no hard feelings over deportation from Australia as he returns for Australian Open
entries.description: Novak Djokovic has reiterated his earlier comments that he bears no hard feelings on his return to Australia after his visa cancellation and subsequent

entries.title: Mixed reactions among Beijing residents as China rolls back Covid policies
entries.description: China has rolled back some of its strictest Covid-19 restrictions as the country moves away from its “zero-Covid” policy, but the easing of restrictions is drawing mixed reaction from Beijing residents as hospitals struggle to cope with rising cases.

entries.title: Massive Russian missile barrage pummels cities across Ukraine
entries.description: Air raid sirens rang out as a massive Russian missile attack hit regions across Ukraine on Thursday.

entries.title: At least 16 killed after fire breaks out at Cambodian casino
entries.description: At least 16 people were killed and dozens injured after a fire broke out at a casino in Poipet, Cambodia, a city near the border with Thailand. Cambodian police said the blaze at the Grand Diamond City Casino, whose cause was not yet known, started at around midnight.

entries.title: Fire at Cambodian hotel casino kills at least 10
entries.description: A fire burning through a Cambodian hotel casino has killed at least 10 people and injured 30 others, police said Thursday, and neighboring Thailand sent

entries.title: Francis calls for prayers for former Pope Benedict’s health
entries.description: Pope Francis revealed his predecessor, Benedict XVI, is very sick in a call for prayers during his general audience. The 95-year-old’s condition worsened due to his age, the Vatican says.
